utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was a nice retirement party.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I guess. Still, it’s a shame Professor Rothman was forced to step down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What choice did the university have? He snapped. It happens to theoretical physicists all the time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I wonder how long Sheldon’s got.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: These shrimp are all the same size. There’s no the logical order to eat them in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can’t be very long.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, look, there’s Rothman’s empty office. Sad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mm, indeed.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So sad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dibs.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: What’s up, fewwas?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing here, Kripke?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Ah, measuwing my new office for dwapes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is not your office. It hasn’t been assigned yet.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Well, I called dibs at the Chwistmas party when Pwofessor Wothman twied to have intercourse with the toys for tots cowwection box.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dibs? This is a university, not a playground. Offices are not assigned because someone called dibs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You just called dibs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shut it. Offices are assigned by seniority. I arrived at the university first.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: I awwived at the office first. I’m the pwoverbial earwy bird.

utterance.speaker: Rothman (entering, naked)
utterance.content: Gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Professor Rothman.

utterance.speaker: Rothman
utterance.content: Good evening.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Good evening.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m glad that men are wearing hats again. They’re so distinguished.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I got you a little something.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: A little something? Oh, it… what, this is huge.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s huge is what you’ve done for me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, Amy, I haven’t done anything.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, no, before I met you, I was a mousy wallflower. But look at me now. I’m like some kind of downtown hipster party girl. With a posse, a boyfriend and a new lace bra that hooks in the front, of all things. Open it. Open it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I wanted to get you something you didn’t have.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. I-I don’t know what to s… Wow.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you like it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do I like it? Wow.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, uh, where are you gonna hang it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Hang it. Wow. Um, you know, I’d have to go get a hook and nails and a hammer and…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, look. You, huh, you just, you got it all right there. Wow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I found him. He’s in the bathroom. President Siebert?

utterance.speaker: Siebert
utterance.content: Can’t this wait?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. We just need a word.

utterance.speaker: Siebert
utterance.content: Now? You realize I’m your boss, and I am holding my penis?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Sheldon, give the man some pwivacy. I’m sowwy. This guy’s got no wespect for boundawies.

utterance.speaker: Siebert
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Will you tell this wunatic that Pwofessor Wothman’s office is wightfully mine?

utterance.speaker: Siebert
utterance.content: Can’t you take this up with your department chairman?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We tried. His assistant said he was on sabbatical. Although we distinctly heard his office window open and shut.

utterance.speaker: Siebert
utterance.content: Gentlemen, there’s a task I’m trying to accomplish here, and I’m having trouble doing it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, my. President Siebert, I don’t mean to be an alarmist, but difficulty initiating a urine stream could be a symptom of benign prostatic hyperplasia. If you’re interested, I can send you a link to a YouTube video that’ll show you how to perform your own rectal exam. Yeah, uh, helpful hint, trim your nails first.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Ignore him, Pwesident Siebert. I’m sure a young man such as yourself has a perfectwy healthy pwostate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, he’s just trying to butter you up. And for the record, butter is an excellent lubricant for your rectal exam.

utterance.speaker: Siebert
utterance.content: Gentlemen, I’m going to allow the two of you to work this out because A, you’re both brilliant scientists, and B, as far as who gets Rothman’s office, I couldn’t give the furry crack of a rat’s behind.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Well, as wong as we’re here, I might as well take a weak.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Kripke?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re in my spot.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That is big.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So big.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And ugly.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So ugly. What am I gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know. You can’t take it down. You’ll break her heart. Look at that face. That enormous, unsettling, crazy face.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is there any chance I’ll learn to love it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That depends. Do you like pictures of yourself where you look like a man?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, it’s got to go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What will you tell Amy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How about I tell her the painting makes you feel jealous because you’re not in it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Nuh-uh. What if she gets me one? I already have a picture of me and Howard’s mom getting our hair cornrowed in Venice Beach. I’ve suffered enough.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I guess I could take it down and put it up when she comes over, but it’s kind of heavy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Mmm, too bad you’re not as strong as the dude in the painting.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Would you look at this? I paid twenty five dollars to some kid on eBay for a handcrafted Harry Potter wand. He sent me a stick. He went into his backyard, he picked up a stick.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s numbered.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, limited edition. Nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (knock on door)
utterance.content: Oh, that’ll be Kripke.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s he doing here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We’re going to work this office situation out like gentlemen. And if that doesn’t work, I’m going to poison his tea.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Kripke. Come in. I’m making tea. Would you like a cup?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Am I weawing a summer fwock? No, I don’t want tea. Wet’s get down to bwass tacks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. In the interest of preserving our friendship…

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: We’re not fwiends.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s a little hard to hear, but all right. As you know, the essence of diplomacy is compromise. With that in mind, I propose the following. I will take Rothman’s office, and you will find a way to be okay with that.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: How about I take Wothman’s office, and you go suck a wemon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You sure I can’t get you that cup of tea?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How about you decide this with Rock-Paper-Scissors-Lizard-Spock?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: What the fwig is that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Rock-Paper-Scissors-Lizard-Spock was created by Internet pioneer Sam Kass as an improvement on the classic game Rock-Paper-Scissors. All hail Sam Kass.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hail.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: How does it work?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, it’s very simple. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock crushes lizard, lizard poisons Spock, Spock smashes scissors, scissors decapitates lizard, lizard eats paper, paper disproves Spock, Spock vaporizes rock, and as it always has, rock crushes scissors.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: I’m sowwy. Can you wepeat that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, of course. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock crushes lizard, lizard poisons Spock, Spock smashes scissors, scissors decapitates lizard, lizard eats paper, paper disproves Spock, Spock vaporizes rock, and as it always has, rock crushes scissors.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Almost got it. One more time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Surely. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, stop. He’s screwing with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is he? Well, then, it seems we have reached an impasse. I see no other option than to challenge you to a duel. I’d smack you with a glove, but just last week I packed away my winter things.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s the 21st century. You can’t have a duel.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: H-h-h-hang on, Howard. Barry, how good of a shot are you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not pistols. Minds. A trivia contest, and you may choose the field of battle. Star Trek trivia, Star Trek: Next Generation trivia, Star Trek: Deep Space Nine trivia, Star Trek: Voyager trivia, or model trains.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: You have a compwete advantage in twivia. You have an eidetic memowy. Pwus, I haven’t watched Star Twek since I discovered the stwip cwub near my apartment has a fwee buffet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s gonna be hard to find something you’re both equally good at.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is there anything you’re both equally bad at?

utterance.speaker: Both
utterance.content: Sports.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, this is one-on-one. First person to five wins the office. Any questions? Yes, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Five what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Balls in the basket.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (dodging out of the way)
utterance.content: Ew!

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: It’s out, wight?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Time. Wan out of woom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know all those terrible things bullies used to do to us?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I get it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey! He did that on purpose,

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, he didn’t. Nothing that’s happening here is being done on purpose. Okay, uh, forget one-on-one. Let’s try a free throw contest. First person who makes a basket wins the office.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Making it too easy there, Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. No, I’m not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Use the force, Sheldon. Use the force. I’m gonna need more force.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Aw wight, Cooper, pwepare to have your heart bwoken. Do I get points for that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, we gave it 45 minutes. It’s no longer funny. Let’s try something else.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do you propose?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, on the count of three, both of you bounce the balls as hard as you can. The highest bounce wins the office.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Oh, you are going down, Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t think so, Kripke. I’ve bounced many a rubber ball in my day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, that’s enough trash talk. One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon was higher.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Congratulations, Sheldon. You win office.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who’s unsatisfactory in P.E. now?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, what a great movie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I cannot believe you’ve never seen Grease.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My mother didn’t allow me to watch it. She was afraid it might encourage me to join a gang.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ve got to go. I’ve got to get up early. My company’s testing a new steroid that supposedly doesn’t shrink testicles, and the last one there has to do the measuring.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess I should get going, too. Good night, painting Penny. Good night, real Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good night, real Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You don’t have to say good night to painting Amy, ’cause she’s never leaving.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good night, real Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good night, transvestite Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ah, okay. Let us take you off the wall. Out of sight, out of mind. I wish.

utterance.speaker: Amy (entering)
utterance.content: You know, can I borrow that movie? Those singing hooligans really got my motor running.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure, sure. Enjoy. I mean, get it back to me when you can, or, you know what, actually, you keep it. It’s just going to be my gift to you. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you. Wait. Where’d the painting go?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s right over there.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I have no idea. That is weird.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You hate it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. No, no. It’s just, it’s a little big.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I feel like an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, come on, you’re not an idiot. Look, just help me put it back up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why? So you can just take it down when I leave? I don’t need your pity.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Amy, come on.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m just glad I didn’t go for the sculpture.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, the spoils. I see why victors love them.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m happy for you, Sheldon. But I have to admit I’m going to miss sharing an office with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, of course you are. Feel free to drop by any time.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. Call first.

utterance.speaker: Rothman
utterance.content: Oh. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Professor Rothman. This isn’t your office any more. You’re retired.

utterance.speaker: Rothman
utterance.content: I think the word you’re looking for is invisible.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I came to say I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t bother.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Amy, please.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m so humiliated. I sat there the whole time that we were watching Grease, thinking you liked the painting.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was a fool from Summer Lovin’ to the very last rama lama lama ke ding a de dinga a dong.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re right. You’re absolutely right. I should have been honest with you and told you the gift was too much.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, too much. Because our friendship is fundamentally asymmetrical. I clearly like you more than you like me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t think you can put a number on how much one person likes another.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I bought you a painting that’s 12 square feet in area. There’s a number.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy, come on…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If you don’t like feet, you can try dollars. The painting set me back three grand.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Three gr… Oh, my God! Look, look, Amy, all you need to know is, you are my friend and I don’t want to lose you out of my life.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’m just having trouble believing you right now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Grab your hammer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. Damage is done.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, I didn’t want to say this, but the real reason I took the painting down was because it made Bernadette very jealous.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, my goodness, how could I have not seen that? The painting is a constant reminder that of the three of us, she is the least cool.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, th-th-th-that’s what it is, so…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You have such a good heart.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Huh, I try.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well where are we going?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We’re going to go put this painting back up in your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what about Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, screw her. She’s just lucky we let her hang out with us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m trying to raise the temperature in here before my nipples tear through my shirt.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why don’t you just turn up the thermostat?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aha! Good question. It turns out the thermostat for my new office isn’t in my new office. No. It’s next door, in Professor Davenport’s office, who is currently enjoying the hot flashes associated with menopause.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why is there a hole here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why is there a hole in my new office? I’ve narrowed it down to two possibilities: There was something in the wall that someone outside the wall wanted, or the more disturbing, there was something in the wall that wanted out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, at least you finally got a window that opens. That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it? Listen.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What, you don’t like wind chimes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I hate them, but it gets worse. There it is.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The bird?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, It’s completely out of tune with the wind chimes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t get it, do you? That’s a mockingbird. Mockingbirds can change their song, which means he’s out of tune on purpose. He’s mocking me. Oh dear. There it is again. Do you feel it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The growing realization that you are one wacky bastard? Yep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. The vibration. We are directly underneath the geology lab, and they’re running their confounded sieve shakers again. Hey, gravel monkeys, if you need to shake rocks, try jiggling your heads around!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, relax.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can I relax? My nervous system is being stretched out like the strings of a harp and plucked by holes and birds and wind and the low-hanging scrotum of the difficult-to-evict Professor Rothman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you’re not happy, why don’t you just let Kripke have the office?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, and let him win? Do I look crazy to you? We’re trying to think down here, you geode-loving feldspar jockeys! And you, the notes are C, D, E, G and A. You pick one or I am chopping down that tree!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How’s that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Little higher on the right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Now?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Little more. No. That’s got it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. That’s, uh, that’s good.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ll let you in on a little secret.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Originally we were painted nude. But I had him add clothes, ’cause I thought it was an unnecessary challenge to our heterosexuality.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, good call.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But if you ever change your mind, all it would take is some warm, soapy water and a couple of sponges.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re talking about the painting, right?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Help! Somebody help!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was trying to see what was in here and my head got stuck.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s called scientific curiosity. Now go get butter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang in there. I’ll be right back.
